title: maDLC 2.2.0.3 error while refining tracklets
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Can not “refine tracklets” during maDLC.

### Operating System

linux ubuntu

### DeepLabCut version

2.2.0.3

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

gpu

### Steps To Reproduce

In GUI , I completed the 'analyze videos' and got el.pickle, full.pickle, meta.pickle and assembiles.pickle files.  

When I run 'Refine tracklets', error shows and I can not get .h5 file to do the next step.

### Relevant log output

```shell
Processing...  /home/molethol/data/zou/distance-KOfamiliar-2022-10-14/videos/20211209-4-1.mp4
/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py:123: FutureWarning: Unlike other reduction functions (e.g. `skew`, `kurtosis`), the default behavior of `mode` typically preserves the axis it acts along. In SciPy 1.11.0, this behavior will change: the default value of `keepdims` will become False, the `axis` over which the statistic is taken will be eliminated, and the value None will no longer be accepted. Set `keepdims` to True or False to avoid this warning.
  return mode(self.data[..., 3], axis=None, nan_policy="omit")[0][0]
100%|█████████████████████████████████████| 2211/2211 [00:00<00:00, 4651.21it/s]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py", line 654, in stitch
    self.paths = self.reconstruct_paths()
  File "/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py", line 952, in reconstruct_paths
    path = self.reconstruct_path(node.replace("in", "out"))
  File "/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py", line 962, in reconstruct_path
    path.extend(self.reconstruct_path(node.replace("in", "out")))
  File "/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py", line 962, in reconstruct_path
    path.extend(self.reconstruct_path(node.replace("in", "out")))
  File "/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py", line 962, in reconstruct_path
    path.extend(self.reconstruct_path(node.replace("in", "out")))
  [Previous line repeated 984 more times]
  File "/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py", line 958, in reconstruct_path
    for node, flow in self.flow[source].items():
RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded while calling a Python object

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/gui/refine_tracklets.py", line 317, in create_tracks
    deeplabcut.stitch_tracklets(
  File "/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py", line 1103, in stitch_tracklets
    stitcher.stitch()
  File "/home/molethol/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py", line 732, in stitch
    raise ValueError(
ValueError: Could not reconstruct 2 tracks from the tracklets given.
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
